Review.Titre: Your customer service is the absolute…
Review.Contenu: Your customer service is the absolute worst.  I have been a customer for a long time and I have sent 5 requests (over the last 2 months) asking for my Call History from April 2020 to September 2020, but PhoneClub has completely ignored all my requests.  Of course, PhoneClub can easily verify my claim. Unless PhoneClub respond to my requests, I will switch to Skype for my paid phone calling needs and PhoneClub will lose me for good.  Time for you to wake up and respond to your customers' needs.

Review.Contenu: I am trying to call my mom but, it is impossible to reaching her ,it is a man voice stay on line and we connected to you family or friends or visit our website www.family and friends.com I am very disappointed for this service.I don’t wan to blame you but if you can help me to talk with my mom really appreciate. I am looking forward for you answers.

Actual charges are:                     3.39c/minI emailed Phoneclub with a PICTURE of the ad, and received a robot reply again stating the charges (not the fake ad).I hate cheaters and liars, so I am moving my business elsewhere.

Poor quality calls on both App (with a superfast Virgin wifi behind it) and through the calling number. Voices were distorted, call got dropped, and then bizarrely the first minute of the dropped call was replayed to me over the phone, with both ends of the call being heard, like it was recorded !I complained through the Phoneclub support page in the website, but got not a single reply.I would avoid this - shame because we had high hopes for replacing the expensive Vodafone calls.FOR PHONECLUB -I did rate both calls as 1 star AND messaged Customer Services but you did not answer and left this stock reply here.

Review.Contenu: The rates went up without any notice. It was around 6 cents per minute for calls to Russia, now it is over 14 cents

The quality of calls via access numbers is below average. The call connections to destinations via access numbers do not always work and thus, if on pay as you go plan, losing mobile credit is inevitable. Also according to my observation, if I start using calls to a particular destination for about a week I notice a price hike to this destination and if stop using it the price goes down in a few weeks time. So Phoneclub is not reliable In terms of prices. Phoneclub is no longer competitive with similar providers.However I do not mind to use occasionally, because some of its rates to some destinations I use are bit lower. Overall, I would not mind to give three stars, however for being so clever to play with its rates it is two!  If it keeps happening in future I will be giving 1 star.

I am a basic phone user and the only service I can use is international calls via access numbers. The call quality is average, the rates are decent but not the best. The only problem is I would like to dial a freephone 0808 number to save more money. However. a surcharge is 2.5p/min, which does not make me happy at all so for that reason I give 2 stars. I would have given 4 or even 4.5 stars if this surcharge had been removed or gone down to 1p/min or 10p as a one call connection charge.

Review.Titre: Always over billed and no access outside usa
Review.Contenu: Phone club seems to be the best choice available however I am always billed incorrectly and it rarely works outside the usa. There is usually a server error

Excellent price. Good connections. Sometimes quality is not the best and call can drop but not that often, actually pretty rare.  Overall, I am happy with this service. I wish they offer monthly service to the country I call.

Generally it works fine but I sometimes experience loss of connection and mechanical voices at the other end. Overall good though, especially considering the price.

Review.Titre: At the beginning we had quite some…hurdles to overcome.
Review.Contenu: At the beginning we had quite some problems:1) There was a terrible background noises on both sides.2) The PhoneClub's PC Java version failed to work on our Google Chrome browser. We then had to install half a dozen of different browsers, because PhoneClub service was unable to tell us in which browser Java works. We almost gave up. - Luckily, in the last moment we discovered that the "Pale Moon" browser works with Java. 3) We then were bombarded with a string of unpleasant echos and repeated, shrill signal tones. So, all in all I cannot say it was easy to make it work. - At least the good people at PhoneClub cared to reward our efforts & waste of time with a 15% discount. They seem to (on the go) monitor and adjusting the sound quality for their customers. Not a bad thing, for lately, the call quality and connection has greatly improved.   :)

Review.Titre: Only occasionally we had some problems…
Review.Contenu: Only occasionally we had some problems with noise injections or dropouts, but in general calls seemed to have gotten better. Keep up the good work!
